question: Do the tutors have experience teaching tuition?
answer: Yes. All our tutors have been teaching since 2022/23. Please view the individual tutors’ page for more information.

question: Have the tutors taught in a group setting before?
answer: Of course! Elijah, Tenor and Jaryl hosted a joint crash course for 15 A Level students in 2025. Kaiser also has experience teaching private group tuition. Building on our collective experience, we have structured our group tuition classes to ensure that every student receives adequate attention and support.

question: How is Vivota different from other tuition centres?
answer: Unlike many other tuition centres that overload students with verbose notes, excessive homework or irrelevant/outdated content, Vivota focuses on identifying each student’s learning gaps and teaching in an exam-oriented manner, supported by personalized mentorship and our structured 14-day learning plans. Through this approach, students can study smarter, avoid wasted effort, and improve their results much faster.

question: What if the student is unable to make it for the lesson due to last minute commitments?
answer: For subjects with 2 sessions a week, the student may opt to attend the other session. If that is not possible, fret not — the student may also join us on Zoom for lesson, and inform the tutor to record that session so that they can replay the lesson in the comfort of their own home.

question: What if I cannot afford lessons at Vivota?
answer: We understand that tuition can be a significant financial commitment, and believe that every student deserves good, high quality education. As such we do offer tuition and education services at no charge for students that need it the most. If you require financial assistance for our classes/education services, please kindly reach out to us via Whatsapp at 80357523.

question: I need advice/help for my university applications. Is Vivota able to help?
answer: Certainly! Please reach out to our dedicated admissions consultant via Whatsapp at 80357523 and we will be happy to provide guidance.

question: Can Vivota help me secure medical internship or volunteering opportunities?
answer: We are happy to assist existing/graduated students with finding internships or volunteering opportunities, including but not limited to job shadowing, meaningful volunteer work and part-time work opportunities. Please speak to our Vivota mentors for more details.

question: I am interested to join Vivota as a tutor. How can I apply?
answer: To ensure the highest education quality for our students, we have a strict selection criteria and all tutors must go through our internship programme before we decide to hire them. The prospective tutor must have scored A for the relevant subject at the A Levels, as well as satisfactory performance across the board for all other subjects. Non-medical undergraduates are welcome to apply as well. Please kindly send your A Level transcript, resume and other relevant documents to us at 80357523 and we will assess your application.
